channel.title: Some MP Suggestions
channel.description:
Okay, here I am, hoping this was not discussed earlier: a few thoughts about MP part of BMS. [b]First[/b] of all, it would be nice if cfgs will be backward-compatible with HLDM (I mean there would be no trouble re-writing all these aliases, binds etc. Just copy/paste.) [b]Second[/b] thing is movement. It's really ugly in HL2 and Source-based games (from my point of HLDM and AGmod player :smiley: ). More speed, more air-control and normal bunnyhop (not HL2DM-style) :slight_smile: It leads me to [b]third[/b] thing: no props on MP maps please! When you are high-speed bhoping around map from enraged player and being stuck in small props (coffee cups for example), it really sucks, beleive me :smiley:
Okay for now, later I'm going to add some more thoughts.
Upd: oh yea, 'bout mp maps: please leave old-good tricks on 'em (ex. various strafe-jumps, crate bhops on stalkyard, strafe-jump rpg pickup on rapidcore and gauss-jump to the window from longjump/egon/hev charger room on crossfire)

item.title: Some MP Suggestions
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
Raminator:

Your suggestions could be summarised to “make Black Mesa deathmatch identical to Half-Life Deathmatch”.

That isn’t what this project is about. We’re rebuilding Half-Life from the ground up, the way we think Valve would have done it if they’d been using the Source engine at the time. It’s not a perfect port of Half-Life; that’d be boring, and really wouldn’t do the game justice. At the end of the day, Half-Life and Black Mesa are going to be two different games.

item.title: Some MP Suggestions
item.dc:creator: snob
item.description:
Rocket jumps do increase speed however the reprocussion in doing so is health. When done perfectly the loss of health is pretty marginal, but still a loss nonetheless. I’d say it’s a technique more than anything.

Bunnyhopping is not a natural evolution of HL gameplay that would naturally happen, it only exists because someone discovered a way to exploit the game engine.

You can’t justify the means just for the gameplay ends. It’s a terrible unintuitive exploit of the game engine that won’t bring any new players to the game, because it’s full of people doing stupid things like bunny hopping to get silly advantages.

Play the game not the engine.

item.title: Some MP Suggestions
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
noob:

oh yea, 'bout mp maps: please leave old-good tricks on 'em

Hey there!

You can find lots of information on the Black Mesa Wiki. There’s also a comprehensive FAQ on there, which states:

I found this bug in the original Half-Life, will it be removed in Black Mesa?
As we are rebuilding Half-Life from the ground up, it will be highly unlikely that the same bugs will appear. We will also be rigorously testing Black Mesa before it is released, to remove any bugs that we inadvertently create. This includes exploits like bunny-hopping.

So I’m afraid there won’t be any bunny hopping in Black Mesa and I bet the developers haven’t recreated much (if any) of the old exploits. That doesn’t mean of course that there won’t be hundreds of completely new tricks for you to feast on.
